1.verse_text: A man named Job lived in the land of Uz. He was an honest man and innocent of any wrong. He honored God and stayed away from evil.
Job had seven sons and three daughters.
He owned 7,000 sheep, 3,000 camels, 500 pairs of oxen and 500 female donkeys. And he had a large number of servants. He was the greatest man among all the people of the East.
Job"s sons took turns holding feasts in their homes. And they invited their sisters to eat and drink with them.

After a feast was over, Job would send and have them made clean. Early in the morning Job would offer a burnt offering for each of them. He thought, 'My children may have sinned and cursed God in their hearts.' Job did this every time.
One day the angels came to show themselves before the Lord. Satan also came with them.

The Lord said to Satan, 'Where have you come from?' Satan answered the Lord, 'I have been wandering around the earth. I have been going back and forth in it.' 'I was naked when I was born. And I will be naked when I die. The Lord gave these things to me. And he has taken them away. Praise the name of the Lord.'
Then the Lord said to Satan, 'Have you noticed my servant Job? No one else on earth is like him. He is an honest man and innocent of any wrong. He honors God and stays away from evil.'
But Satan answered God, 'Job honors God for a good reason.
You have put a wall around him, his family and everything he owns. You have blessed the things he has done. So his flocks of sheep and herds of cattle are large. They almost cover the land.
But reach out your hand and destroy everything he has. Then he will curse you to your face.'
The Lord said to Satan, 'All right, then. Everything Job has is in your power. But you must not touch Job himself.' Then Satan left the Lord"s presence.
One day Job"s sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine together. They were at the oldest brother"s house.
A messenger came to Job and said, 'The oxen were plowing. And the donkeys were eating grass nearby.
And the Sabeans attacked and carried them away. They killed the servants with swords. And I am the only one who escaped to tell you!'

The messenger was still speaking when another messenger came in. He said, 'Lightning from God fell from the sky. It burned up the sheep and the servants. And I am the only one who escaped to tell you!'

The second messenger was still speaking when another messenger came in. He said, 'The Babylonians sent three groups of attackers. They swept down and stole your camels. They killed the servants. And I am the only one who escaped to tell you!'
The third messenger was still speaking when another messenger came in. He said, 'Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine together. They were at the oldest brother"s house.

Suddenly a great wind came in from the desert. It struck all four corners of the house at once. The house fell in on your sons and daughters. And they are all dead. I am the only one who escaped to tell you!'
When Job heard this, he got up. To show how sad he was he tore his robe and shaved his head. Then he bowed down to the ground to worship God.
He said:
In all this Job did not sin. He did not blame God.

2.verse_text: On another day the angels came to show themselves before the Lord. And Satan also came with them.
The Lord said to Satan, 'Where have you come from?' Satan answered the Lord, 'I have been wandering around the earth. I have been going back and forth in it.'

Then the Lord said to Satan, 'Have you noticed my servant Job? No one else on earth is like him. He is an honest man, innocent of any wrong. He honors God and stays away from evil. You caused me to ruin him for no good reason. But he continues to be without blame.'
'One skin for another!' Satan answered. 'A man will give all he has to save his own life.
But reach out your hand and destroy his own flesh and bones. Then he will curse you to your face.'
The Lord said to Satan, 'All right, then. Job is in your power. But you must let him live.'
So Satan left the Lord"s presence. And he put painful sores all over Job"s body. They went from the top of his head to the soles of his feet.
Then Job took a piece of broken pottery. And he used it to scrape himself. He sat in ashes to show how upset he was.
Job"s wife said to him, 'Are you still trying to stay innocent? You should just curse God and die!'
Job answered, 'You are talking like a foolish woman. Should we take only good things from God and not trouble?' In all this Job did not sin in what he said.

Now Job had three friends. They were Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite. These friends heard about the troubles that had happened to Job. So they agreed to meet and go see Job. They wanted to show him they were upset for him, too. And they wanted to comfort him.
They saw Job from far away. But he looked so different they almost didn"t recognize him. They began to cry loudly. They tore their robes and put dirt on their heads to show how sad they were.
Then they sat on the ground with Job seven days and seven nights. No one said a word to him. This was because they saw how much he was suffering.

3.verse_text: After seven days Job spoke. He cursed the day he had been born.
Job said:

'Let the day I was born be destroyed. And destroy the night when it was said, "A boy is born!" Let God not even care about it. Don"t let light shine on that day. Let a cloud hide that day. Let darkness cover its light. Don"t count it among the days of the year. Don"t put it in any of the months. Let no shout of joy be heard in it. They know how to wake up the sea monster Leviathan. Let it wait for daylight, but don"t let it come. Don"t let it see the first light of dawn. That day did not hide trouble from my eyes. Why didn"t I die when I came out of the womb? Why did my mother"s breasts feed me? I would be asleep and at rest. They built places for themselves that are now ruined. They filled their houses with silver! I wish I were like a baby who never saw the light of day. And people who are tired are at rest. They no longer hear the shout of the slave driver. And the slave is freed from his master. Why is it given to those who are so unhappy? They search for death more than for hidden treasure. when they get to the grave. It shouldn"t be given to a man who feels trapped by God. My groans pour out like water. And the thing I dreaded has happened. I have no rest. I only have trouble.'
Let that day turn to darkness.
Let darkness and gloom have that day.
Let thick darkness capture that night.
Let that night be empty.
Let the people who curse days curse that day.
Let that day"s morning stars become dark.
This is because it allowed me to be born.
'Why didn"t I die as soon as I was born?
Why did my mother"s knees receive me?
If they had not been there, I would be lying dead in peace.
I would be asleep with kings and wise men of the earth.
I would be asleep with rulers who had gold.
Or why was I not buried like a child born dead?
In the grave the wicked stop causing trouble.
In the grave there is rest for the captives.
People great and small are in the grave.
'Why is life given to those who are in misery?
Some people want to die, but death does not come.
They are very happy
Life shouldn"t be given to a man who doesn"t know what will happen to him.
I make sad sounds as I eat.
The thing I was afraid of has happened to me.
I have no peace. I have no quietness.

5.verse_text: 'Call if you want to, but no one will answer you. You can"t turn to any of the holy ones. And jealousy kills a weak-minded person. But suddenly his home was destroyed. Foolish anger kills a person.
I have seen a fool have success like a tree taking root.
His children are far away from safety.
Hungry people eat this fool"s harvest.
Hard times do not come up from the ground.
But man is born to have trouble
'But if I were you, I would call on God.
God does wonderful things that cannot be understood.
God gives rain to the earth.
God makes the humble person important.
God ruins the plans of those who trick others.
He catches wise men in their own clever traps.
Darkness covers them up in the daytime.
God saves needy people from their lies.
So the poor people have hope.
'The person whom God corrects is happy.
God hurts, but he also bandages up.
He will save you from six troubles.
God will buy you back from death in times of hunger.
You will be hidden from the tongue that hits like a whip.
You will laugh at destruction and hunger.
This is because you will have an agreement with the animals born in the wild.
You will know that your tent is safe.
You will know that you will have many children.
You will come to the grave with all your strength.
'We have checked this, and it is true.

6.verse_text: Then Job answered:

'I wish my suffering could be weighed. And I wish my misery could be put on the scales. No wonder my words seem careless. My spirit drinks in their poison. God"s terrors are gathered against me. An ox is quiet when it has feed. There is no flavor in the white part of an egg. Such food makes me sick. How I wish God would give me what I hope for. and reach out his hand to destroy me. And you would trade away your friend. I would not lie to your face. Think again, because my innocence is being questioned. I can tell the difference between right and wrong.
My sadness would be heavier than the sand of the seas.

A wild donkey does not bray when it has grass to eat.

'How I wish I might have what I ask for.
I wish God would be willing to crush me

'I do not have the strength to wait.

'They say, "A man"s friends should be kind to him when he is in trouble.
But my brothers cannot be counted on.
They are like streams made dark by melting ice,
But they stop flowing when it is the dry season.
Groups of travelers turn away from their paths.
The groups of travelers from Tema look for water.
They are upset because they had been sure.
You also have been no help.
I have never said, "Give me a gift.
Save me from the enemy"s power.
'Teach me, and I will be quiet.
Honest words are painful!
Do you mean to correct what I say?
You would even throw lots for orphans.
'But now please look at me.
Change your mind. Do not be unfair.
What I am saying is not wicked.

The night is long, and I toss until dawn. My skin is broken and full of running sores. And they come to an end without hope. My eyes will never see happy times again. You will look for me, but I will be gone. In the same way, a person who goes where the dead are does not return. His place will not know him anymore. I will speak out in the suffering of my spirit. Why have you made me your target? Have I become a heavy load for you? and forgive my sins? I will soon lie down in the dust and die. You will search for me, but I will be no more.'
Man is like a slave wishing for the evening shadows.
But I am given months that are empty.
When I lie down, I think, "How long is it until I get up?"
My body is covered with worms and scabs.
'My days go by faster than a weaver moves his tool.
Remember, God, that my life is only as long as a breath.
Those who see me now will see me no more.
A cloud disappears and is gone.
He will never come back to his house again.
'So I will not stay quiet.
I am not the sea or the sea monster.
Sometimes I think my bed will comfort me.
Then you frighten me with dreams.
My throat prefers to be choked.
I hate my life. I don"t want to live forever.
'Why do you make man so important?
Will you examine him every morning?
Will you never look away from me?
If I have sinned, what have I done to you,
Why don"t you pardon my wrongs

'How long will you say such things? Your words are no more than a strong wind. God All-Powerful does not make wrong what is right. And he punished them for their sins. Pray to God All-Powerful for mercy. Then he will start doing something for you. And he will bring you back where you belong. because your future will be so successful. and find out what their ancestors learned. Our days on earth are like only a shadow. God does not twist fairness.
Your children sinned against God.
But you should ask God for help.
You must be good and honest.
The place you began will seem unimportant
'Ask old people

Those people will teach you and tell you.

While they are still growing and not yet cut,

What he trusts in is easily broken.
He leans on the spider"s web, but it breaks.
He is like a well-watered plant in the sunshine.
It wraps its roots around a pile of rocks.
But the plant may be torn from its place.
Then its life dries up.
'Surely God does not reject innocent men.
God will yet fill your mouth with laughter.
Your enemies will be covered in shame.

'I am innocent.

'My days go by faster than a runner.

'God is not a man like me. So I cannot answer him.

I wish someone could remove God"s punishment from me.

Don"t you care about me, the work of your own hands? Are you happy with the plans of evil people? Do you see as a man sees? Are your years like the years of a man? and search for my sin. I will say to God: Do not hold me guilty.

'All these words should not go without an answer. Is this talker to be judged as right? People should shame you when you make fun of God. And I am clean in God"s sight." 14.verse_text: 'All of us born to women live only a few days and have a lot of trouble. We are like a passing shadow that does not last. Do you need to bring him before you to be judged? After the Lord had said these things to Job, he spoke to Eliphaz the Temanite. The Lord said to him, 'I am angry with you and your two friends. This is because you have not said what is right about me. But my servant Job did.

So now take seven bulls and seven male sheep. Go to my servant Job. And offer a burnt offering for yourselves. My servant Job will pray for you. And I will listen to his prayer. Then I will not punish you for being foolish. You have not said what is right about me. But my servant Job did.'
So Eliphaz the Temanite did as the Lord told him to do. Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite also did as the Lord said. And the Lord listened to Job"s prayer.
After Job had prayed for his friends, God gave him success again. God gave Job twice as much as he had owned before.

Job"s brothers and sisters came to his house. Everyone who had known him before came to his house. And they all ate with him there. They comforted Job and spoke kindly to him. They made him feel better about the trouble the Lord had brought on him. And each one gave Job a piece of silver and a gold ring.
The Lord blessed the last part of Job"s life even more than the first part. Job had 14,000 sheep and 6,000 camels. He had 1,000 pairs of oxen and 1,000 female donkeys.
Job also had seven sons and three daughters.
He named the first daughter Jemimah. The second daughter he named Keziah. And his third daughter he named Keren-Happuch.
There were no other women in all the land as beautiful as Job"s daughters. And their father Job gave them land to own along with their brothers.
After this, Job lived 140 years. He lived to see his children, grandchildren, great-grandchildren and great-great-grandchildren.
Then Job died. He was old and had lived many years.
